page.title: 18Haunting at Cheriton Bishop
page.content: The owner of Lower West Pitton many years ago was a rather eccentric lady. She dressed all in black, a long gown, small bonnet and high-buttoned shoes: of a very frail appearance, with a small face and very hooked nose, she bent over her walking stick. It is said that the little old lady in black has been seen on a couple of occasions, taking a great interest in all the changes. Since her death the property has acquired new owners and a new name. Now known as "Spinneybrook", it has undergone considerable renovation and updating, but it still has on either side of the front window a heart and a diamond worked in plaster to mark the fact that the property once changed hands on a game of cards.
